intro: Schivereckia hyperborea, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold, harsh environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Schivereckia hyperborea is adapted to survive in low-nutrient conditions and is often found in tundra ecosystems.
